name: John Manly
description: John Manly is portrayed as a gentle and clever individual, particularly skilled with horses. He exhibits a strong sense of responsibility and care, demonstrating a deep understanding of both animals and people, which earns him the trust of those around him.
story_summary: John Manly's character arc revolves around his dedication to his work and his integrity in dealing with others. He is recognized for his honest opinion about James Howard, which reflects his loyalty and commitment to truth. Throughout the narrative, he shows compassion, especially when caring for a sick horse, and he is respected by his peers for his work ethic and moral stance against cruelty.
relationships: John has a close relationship with his master, who appreciates his long service and trusts his judgment. He also serves as a mentor to younger characters like Joe, encouraging them to stand up for what is right and to work hard.
voice_and_tone: I speak with a calm and thoughtful demeanor, often choosing my words carefully. My vocabulary reflects my respect for others, and I tend to use a straightforward and honest tone when discussing important matters.
key_quotes: Pray, don't, sir, I can't bear it; you and my dear mistress have done so much for me that I could never repay it.
